When we left for our "local" vacation at the central coast in late June, we fully expected to come home to find our county had moved on to Phase 2 of reopening. Instead, Covid-19 exploded while we were gone.We had no idea just how bad the Covid-19 situation had become until over halfway through our stay when we were at an emergency vet and I decided to see what was up in the state. Where we stayed had no cell or internet access or TV.If our vacation was upcoming, I would not feel right to take it in light of not only the Covid-19 cases in Oregon but also the explosion of cases across the United States. And there is no way I would have traveled any real distance for a vacation during a pandemic that has no vaccine or reliable treatment. And that was before things got bad here. We had our masks. We wore gloves. We used hand sanitizer after removing our gloves. We used Clorox wipes and disinfected cards used to pay for the few groceries and take-out orders. I still wouldn't travel now if it involved any interaction with other people or staying in a hotel or motel or rental property or anywhere with a communal bathroom (campground.)I do not want to be someone who has it and doesn't know it. Who spreads it to an area with limited medical facilities like the coast. Who gives it to someone who then gives it to a person who is vulnerable.I do not want to take the chance that I could cause the death of someone I don't even know because I wanted to go on a vacation during an out of control pandemic.

Of course I would never want to cause someone death.I went to Yellowstone 3 weeks ago and travel around Montana. We had a wonderful time and yes we wore mask. Everyone was enjoying there vacation as normal. The campground were full as well as rodeos and restaurants.I work in the public everyday and the children are going back to school. My granddaughter is 18 and needs something happy in her life. She didn’t get to finish her senior year, no prom, and now she can’t go off to college. She’s always wanted to come to Seattle and Portland, so we are coming. I’m not going to go around people any more than we have to.

Silljunk,Montana is where we normally visit. My husband is from there. We have family that live there. We have friends who live there. There's no amount of money in the world I could have been paid to take my normal "We only see a half-dozen people the entire trip" vacation to SW Montana this year.Montana has seen an explosion in cases and masks are supposed to be mandatory now.The majority of the locals won't take it seriously. Bars are packed. No social distancing. Masks are a violation of free speech and law enforcement won't enforce the mask rules.Butte had a corn hole tournament for charity. The pictures show unmasked groups of people standing shoulder-to-shoulder. The people we know in Ennis said the rodeo was a nightmare of people going about as if there was no deadly disease circulating.The county we normally stay in near Yellowstone is seeing community spread. They have a hospital that has no ICU beds. They have a few doctors. That's it for the county for medical services. The people who have Covid-19 but aren't sick enough to be hospitalized in another county or bed ridden are not isolating because it's "Just the flu."But, you are going to come anyway even if the people who live here and are facing the prospect of businesses being shut down again, schools not reopening this fall, medical procedures such as cancer removal surgeries being halted again, and massive rises in unemployment again are asking you to put off your visit until the danger of serious, lasting, debilitating illness or even death is gone.People who may also have children or grandchildren or siblings or loved ones who also did not get to do their senior prom or senior class trip or walk across the stage to get their diploma or get to go off to college this fall.Please get a Covid-19 test before you come. I don't know if Tennessee is still doing free Covid-19 tests for anyone who wants them. I know my friends out there said anyone with ID could drop into a testing site and get the test.Make sure you keep track of the places you go, what time you get there, how long you stayed, and when you left. Anything you can do to help out the already overwhelmed contact tracers would be greatly appreciated.

This is getting better & better. You aren't coming to the city and aren't going to go around people any more than you have to, but the trip is premised on the fact that your granddaughter who is incapable of happiness without a prom, etc has always wanted to go to Portland & Seattle. All righty. You betcha!~ Colleen

"It’s hard to understand why someone needs to be convinced to stay away from Portland and or Oregon. There is time in life to travel and see wonderful places. This summer just isn’t that time. Next spring or summer we can all hit the road, maybe with a mask, but this summer is too dangerous for many reasons, and Portland in particular is not a vacation destination."Not necessarily picking on you, but people always state this like it is a fact that come 2021 the virus will go poof and we will all be able to travel wherever again. The reason I am traveling this summer is because it is allowed, and there are no guarantees it will be allowed this fall, or next spring or summer for that matter. There is no vaccine - and when there is one (IF there ever is one), less than 50% of the country will actually get said vaccine ...

MikeG--So what about the Governor's comments? Just because something is allowed does not mean it is smart. When locals are asking people to stay away, I cannot imagine going somewhere that I would not be welcome. That is really disrespectful, IMO.

What comments? That they are thinking about instituting a quarantine for people coming from States that are hotspots? I mean sure, when they actually implement a quarantine, it would be silly to travel to someplace that required a 14 day quarantine. But, there is nothing implemented yet - and even if it were, they are talking about States who have a higher % rate right now, which would not apply to NJ, since we are one of the States with a very low rate currently. As for the locals asking people to stay away, that is not representative of ALL locals. I am sure the one's who own businesses would not share the same thoughts as yourself. Honestly though, I can only speak for myself, and I am not interested in traveling to Oregon (or anywhere) to hang out with, or meet the locals. I travel to go hiking, and take pictures.

Mike, you are correct. This is not going away for awhile. It may never go away. I’m one of the 50% that will not get the vaccine. I work everyday in the public with a mask on and I don’t want to sit and wait for someone to find how to get this under control. The survivor rate is 95%. There’s been viruses throughout history and we have never closed the world down. If we don’t continue to live the USA will crash. I care nothing about being told what I can and can’t do with my life or where I can go. If we let them do this, we are in for trouble.As you can see there’s a lot of people falling for the BS. I care nothing about being in large groups and yes, I do wear a mask. We will spent 80% in the car, riding and enjoying the beauty of our beautiful country. Everyone has been on edge for months and it’s not helping, so I’ve decided life is to short not to enjoy it. We never know from day to day what life will bring. Only God knows that. I never in a million years expected to get the treatment I have because I ask a question.
